p: Plantains and banana belong to the Musa genus [plantain: Musa AAB ( Musa parasidiaca); banana: Musa AAA]. Plantain plants produce larger and more angular starchy fruits of hybrid triploid cultivars than other species in the Musa family, and are generally used for cooking ( Robinson, 1996). There has been much research on several parts of banana plants, however, the amount of research on plantain is limited despite the roots and stems of plantain being adjudged by folklore to possess medicinal properties, including antidiabetic and antilipidemic potentials ( Omobuwajo et al., 2011; Kalita et al., 2016).
